metadata.title: CVE-2024-46673 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:scsi: aacraid: Fix double-free on probe failureaac_probe_one() calls hardware-specific init functions through theaac_driver_ident::init pointer, all of which eventually call down toaac_init_adapter().If aac_init_adapter() fails after allocating memory for aac_dev::queues,it frees the memory but does not clear that member.After the hardware-specific init function returns an error,aac_probe_one() goes down an error path that frees the memory pointed toby aac_dev::queues, resulting.in a double-free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-46673` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-260-generic - 4.4.0-260.294~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-260-generic - 4.4.0-260.294~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-260-lowlatency - 4.4.0-260.294~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1137-aws - 4.4.0-1137.143
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1182-azure - 4.15.0-1182.197~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-260.294~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1137.143').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1182.197~14.04.1').
